scenarios.title: It's a School Day!

listening.receptive: Follow very simple classroom instructions with visual cues.
listening.interactive: Engage in basic interactive games with instructions.

reading.reading: Recognize basic familiar words supported with illustrations or visual aids.
reading.reading2: Attempt to read basic and familiar words supported with pictures.
reading.phonemic_awareness: Identify sounds at the beginning of words.

speaking.productive: Use simple words to express basic needs.
speaking.interactive: Engage in question-and-answer exchanges using simple words and gestures.

writing.productive: Practice tracing and copying letters of the alphabet.

mediation.text: Identify objects on the pages of picture books, using simple words.

pragmatic: Following instructions: respond to commands like 'stand up'
sociolinguistic: Politeness and formality: use 'Please stand up'

assessment_ideas: Observe student responses during Simon Says or similar command games.
Check labeling of classroom objects in posters or digital drawings.
Assess ability to identify objects in picture books using single words.

scenarios.title: Our Routines

listening.receptive: Show comprehension of basic commands used in the classroom.

reading.reading: Identify characters in a picture book.
reading.reading2: Match spoken words to their written form as they are heard and supported with pictures.

speaking.productive: Name daily activities, using isolated words.
speaking.interactive: Engage with simple commands using basic words and gestures.

writing.productive: Write simple words with model guidance.

mediation.concept: Use gestures and drawings to link daily routines to classroom activities that are performed.

pronunciation: Letter sounds: A, B, C, D, E

pragmatic: Describing daily routines with sequencing words
sociolinguistic: Routine interactions: 'Please, pick up the paper.'

assessment_ideas: Observe participation in routine role-plays.
Review labeled routine charts or digital timelines.
Check copying of simple words like 'sit' or 'pen' in labeling tasks.

scenarios.title: Hold Up Ten Fingers!

listening.receptive: Show comprehension of basic commands used in the classroom.

reading.reading: Recognize basic familiar words supported with illustrations or visual aids.
reading.reading2: Show comprehension of storybook sequencing by pointing to pictures with the teacher's guidance.

speaking.productive: Count out loud up to ten with help.
speaking.interactive: Respond nonverbally to simple yes/no questions by nodding or shaking head.

writing.productive: Write simple words, with model guidance.

mediation.concept: Use gestures and drawings to link daily routines to classroom activities that are performed.

pronunciation: Letter sounds: F, G, H, I, J

pragmatic: Counting aloud in response to prompts
sociolinguistic: Encouraging turn-taking and active listening during group counting

assessment_ideas: Observe finger-counting during group activities.
Review counting books with labeled drawings.
Assess ability to respond to 'Is this number five?' with yes/no and gestures.

scenarios.title: Where Is It?

listening.receptive: Follow very simple classroom instructions with visual cues.
listening.interactive: Follow along during group story time.

reading.reading: Participate in choral reading sessions, supported by the teacher.
reading.reading2: Match spoken words to their written form as they are heard and supported with pictures.

mediation.text: Identify objects on the pages of picture books, using simple words.

grammar: WH-Questions for Location (e.g., 'Where is the book?')
pronunciation: Letter sounds: K, L, M, N, O

pragmatic: Using location words: 'The book is on the desk.'
Following location commands: 'Go to the window.'
sociolinguistic: Polite request: 'Show me the blue crayon, please.'
Giving location information: 'It’s on the desk.'

assessment_ideas: Observe participation in preposition scavenger hunts.
Review classroom maps with labeled object locations.
Check responses to 'Where is the pen?' using gestures or words.

scenarios.title: What's that Sound?

listening.receptive: Follow very simple classroom instructions with visual cues.

reading.reading: Recognize basic familiar words supported with illustrations or visual aids.
reading.reading2: Match spoken words to their written form as they are heard and supported with pictures.

speaking.productive: Identify things in simple pictures, using isolated words.

writing.productive: Write simple words with model guidance.

mediation.communication: Relay messages from teacher to peers.

pronunciation: Letter sounds in animal names: C in 'cat', D in 'dog'; letters P, Q, R

assessment_ideas: Observe participation in animal sound guessing games.
Review labeled animal drawings with sound words (e.g., 'cow – moo').
Assess ability to mimic sounds in response to prompts.

scenarios.title: Let's Dance!
themes: One Step In, Two Steps Out!

listening.receptive: Show comprehension of basic commands used in the classroom.

reading.reading: Show comprehension of storybook sequencing by pointing to pictures with the teacher's guidance.
reading.reading2: Match spoken words to their written form as they are heard and supported with pictures.

speaking.interactive: Engage with simple commands using basic words and gestures.

mediation.concept: Use gestures and drawings to link daily routines to classroom activities that are performed.

grammar: Simple directive phrases (e.g., 'Move to the front.')
vocabulary: numbers 1–1, step, dance, foot, circle, line, voice
pronunciation: Letter sounds: J in 'jump'; letters S, T, U, V

pragmatic: Reciting action rhymes like 'Head, Shoulders, Knees, and Toes'
sociolinguistic: Group participation: using 'after you' or 'go ahead'

assessment_ideas: Observe performance in dance sequence videos.
Review labeled movement drawings (e.g., 'jump', 'run').
Assess ability to follow instructions like 'two steps out.'

scenarios.title: I'm Happy.

reading.reading: Match spoken words to their written form as they are heard and supported with pictures.
reading.reading2: Participate in choral reading sessions, supported by the teacher.

speaking.productive: Use simple words to express basic needs.
speaking.interactive: Express likes or dislikes using simple words and pointing.

writing.productive: Practice tracing and copying letters of the alphabet.

mediation.communication: Relay messages from teacher to peers.

pronunciation: Letter sounds: E in 'rest', H in 'happy'; letters W, X, Y, Z

sociolinguistic: Discussing feelings and recognizing others’ emotions

assessment_ideas: Observe use of 'I’m...' statements during emotion bingo.
Review labeled emotion face charts or digital wheels.
Assess gestures used to convey feelings (e.g., fanning for 'hot').
